translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions

analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  kusalattika chaga ucchakaduka
translated: The Triad-Couplet Section of the Conditions

original: Akusalaṁ saññojanaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… ganthaṁ …pe… oghaṁ …pe… yogaṁ …pe… nīvaraṇaṁ …pe… parāmāsaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam saññojanam dhammam paṭicca pe gantham pe ogham pe yogam pe nīvaraṇam pe parāmāsa saṅkhitta
translated: With an unprofitable fetter as condition there is … (as in the preceding chapter up to:) With an unprofitable tie as condition there is … With an unprofitable flood as condition there is … With an unprofitable yoke as condition there is … With an unprofitable hindrance as condition there is … With an unprofitable wrongness as condition there is … With an unprofitable distortion as condition there is … With an unprofitable underlying tendency as condition there is … With an unprofitable shackle as condition there is … With an unprofitable animal as condition there is … With an unprofitable birth as condition there is … With an unprofitable descent as condition there is … With an unprofitable rearising as condition there is … With an unprofitable reappearance as condition there is … With an unprofitable manifestation as condition there is … With an unprofitable appearance as condition there is … With an unprofitable ageing as condition there is … With an unprofitable sickness as condition there is … With an unprofitable death as condition there is … With an unprofitable sorrow as condition there is … With an unprofitable lamentation as condition there is … With an unprofitable pain as condition there is … With an unprofitable grief as condition there is … With an unprofitable despair as condition there is … With an unprofitable perversion as condition there is … With an unprofitable view as condition there is … With an unprofitable adherence as condition there is … With an unprofitable craving as condition there is … With an unprofitable feeling as condition there is … With an unprofitable contact as condition there is … With an unprofitable sixfold base as condition there is … With an unprofitable name-and-form as condition there is … With an unprofitable consciousness as condition there is … With an unprofitable action as condition there is … With an unprofitable ignorance as condition there are the four formations that find expression in bodily action, in speech, and in thought. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate pañca
translated: With a cause as condition there are five. With an object as condition there are three. … With an absence of bewilderment as condition there are five. (Abbreviated.)
